backend/main.mo: Motoko actor managing citizen complaints with role-based access control, lifecycle fields, priority scoring, and storage integration.
feature_evidence.json: Lists feature evidence for removing footer branding, referencing affected frontend files and related components.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries of all frontend source files describing their purpose and behavior.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base style layer defining OKLCH color variables and dark mode overrides.
frontend/index.html: Basic HTML entry point mounting the React app and loading main.tsx.
frontend/README.md: Setup guide explaining prerequisites and steps for running the Civic Lens frontend.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React router configuration with authentication and password modal handling.
frontend/src/components/auth/LoginButton: Login/logout control clearing identity, password verification, and query cache on logout.
frontend/src/components/auth/ProfileSetu: Modal for registering or verifying a password with validation and mutation calls.
Type definitions for password modal props and constants.
frontend/src/components/auth/SignInOptio: Sign‑in component offering Google and Apple login via Internet Identity wrapper.
frontend/src/components/complaints/Befor: Displays before/after complaint photos with status-based badges and fallback when after photo is missing.
frontend/src/components/complaints/Compl: Shows complaint metadata including priority, SLA, timestamps, location, and reporter info.
frontend/src/components/complaints/Escal: Renders a destructive badge indicating when a complaint was escalated with relative time.
frontend/src/components/complaints/Photo: Handles image upload with validation, preview display, and removal for complaint photo evidence.
frontend/src/components/complaints/Prior: Shows a color-coded badge reflecting priority level based on urgency score.
frontend/src/components/complaints/SlaBa: Displays SLA status, marking overdue items or showing remaining time until due.
frontend/src/components/feedback/Resolut: Allows users to confirm resolution and submit rating and comments for a complaint.
frontend/src/components/layout/AppLayout: Defines the main app layout with navigation, authentication-aware links, and responsive mobile menu.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages an authenticated or anonymous backend actor and refreshes dependent queries on change.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity auth context, including login, logout, identity loading, and status management.
frontend/src/hooks/usePasswordVerificati: Hook managing session-based password verification with sync across tabs.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Collection of React Query hooks for fetching and mutating complaint and user-role data via the actor API.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS setup defining theme variables and base styles for light and dark modes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: App entry point initializing React Query, identity provider, and rendering the root component.
frontend/src/pages/citizen/MyReportsPage: Citizen dashboard listing the user's submitted complaints with status, badges, and detail links.
frontend/src/pages/citizen/SubmitComplai: Form page allowing authenticated citizens to submit civic complaints with category, description, location, and photo.
frontend/src/pages/complaints/ComplaintD: Displays complaint details, status, photos, and admin tools for updating status and uploading resolution photos.
frontend/src/pages/DocsPage.tsx: Documentation page outlining prerequisites and setup steps for running Civic Lens.
frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx: Landing page presenting the app’s purpose, sign-in options, and feature overview.
frontend/src/pages/official/HigherOffici: Shows escalated complaints to higher officials with priority and escalation details for review.
frontend/src/pages/official/OfficialDash: Dashboard for officials to manage open and in‑progress complaints with filtering and quick access to details.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for reading, storing, and clearing URL and session parameters, supporting hash-based routing.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending themes, colors, animations, and enabling typography, container queries, and animation plugins.
project_state.json: Defines the project’s current state, including Civic Lens requirements, architectural notes, existing features, constraints, and workflow rules such as deduplication and a 72‑hour deadline with escalation.
